Description: Foot and lower body sherd of probably Corinthian pottery kotyle; offset disc on underside of bowl; interior glazed black (much worn); exterior: above junction with foot, frieze of thin rays and one black band; drip marks running down on to foot; on foot, traces of band in added red; underside: wide and narrow concentric black bands and one wide red band; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: C.W. Neeft (personal communication) considers that this sherd is an imitation Corinthian skyphos with a Corinthian slip.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 486)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.253) (phase 3)
